kexp.config.dds_id module

kexp.config.dds_id.dds_empty_frame(x=None)[source]
class kexp.config.dds_id.dds_frame(expt_params: ~kexp.config.expt_params.ExptParams = <kexp.config.expt_params.ExptParams object>, dac_frame_obj: ~kexp.config.dac_id.dac_frame = [], shuttler_frame_obj: ~kexp.config.shuttler_id.shuttler_frame = [], core: ~artiq.coredevice.core.Core = [])[source]

Bases: object

Associates each dds with a instance of the DDS class for use in experiments. Also, records the AO order, DAC channels associated with VVA/PID set points, associated transition for detuning calulations, and default frequency/amplitudes.

dds_assign(uru, ch, default_freq=-0.1, default_detuning=-0.1, default_amp=-0.1, ao_order=0, double_pass=True, transition='None', dac_ch_vpd=-1) → DDS[source]

Instantiates and returns a DDS object for the given urukul and channel.

Parameters:

  • uru (int) – The urukul card index. 0-indexed.

  • ch (int) – The channel of this DDS. 0-indexed.

  • default_freq (float, optional) – The default frequency (in Hz) to

  • on. (which this DDS channel should turn)

  • default_detuning (float, optional) – The default detuning (in

  • on.

  • default_amp (_type_, optional) – The default amplitude (0 to 1) to

  • on.

  • ao_order (int, optional) – Specifies the AO order (if applicable) as

  • -1. (leave as)

  • double_pass (bool, optional) – Specifies if the AO is set up as a

  • True. (double pass for detuning calculations. Defaults to)

  • transition (specify the) – If the AO controls near-resonant light,

  • transition

  • dac_ch_vpd (int, optional) – If controlling an AO with a VVA in line

  • DDS (with the)

  • which (this should specify the DAC channel number)

  • control (controls that VVA. For no DAC)

  • -1.

Returns:

DDS

init_cooling()[source]

See ‘power_down_cooling`. Reboots the DDS cores for the near-resonant light and sets them to their defaults.

make_dds_array()[source]

Creates an array of shape (N_uru,N_ch) containing DDS objects for each channel.

First loops through the DDS objects that were explicitly assigned as attributes using dds_assign, then fills in the remaining DDS channels.

power_down_cooling()[source]

Turn off the near-resonant light for long hold times to avoid light leakage interacting with the atoms.

write_dds_keys()[source]

Adds the assigned keys to the DDS objects so that the user-defined names (keys) are available with the DDS objects.
